name: Public Records Analysis
description: Using government, corporate, and public databases for intelligence gathering.

cards.title: Corporate Research and Business Intelligence
cards.description: Investigating businesses, financials, and corporate relationships.
bulletpoints: Use tools like OpenCorporates and SEC EDGAR for corporate lookups
Analyze financial reports and SEC filings for hidden risks
Track shell companies and money laundering operations
cards.summaryText: Mine corporate registries and filings to reveal hidden relationships and risk signals.

cards.title: Government and Legal Database Access
cards.description: Extracting intelligence from public records and government databases.
bulletpoints: Use FOIA (Freedom of Information Act) requests for legal intelligence
Search court records, patent filings, and land registry databases
Leverage electoral rolls and leaked government databases for investigations
cards.summaryText: Leverage FOIA and public legal datasets to extract authoritative investigative leads.

cards.title: Property and Real Estate Intelligence
cards.description: Analyzing real estate transactions, ownership, and hidden assets.
bulletpoints: Use Zillow, county assessor databases, and land registries to verify ownership
Track offshore real estate holdings and money laundering properties
Analyze mortgage records for financial vulnerabilities
cards.summaryText: Cross-check property records to expose ownership trails and financial vulnerabilities.

cards.title: Sanctions and Watchlist Intelligence
cards.description: Checking individuals and entities against global sanctions lists.
bulletpoints: Use OFAC, Interpol, and UN sanctions lists for restricted entities
Analyze export control lists and trade restrictions
Track individuals flagged by financial crime watchlists
cards.summaryText: Compare subjects against global sanctions and watchlists to flag restricted actors.

cards.title: Patent and Trademark Investigations
cards.description: Researching intellectual property ownership and legal disputes.
bulletpoints: Use USPTO, WIPO, and EPO databases for patents and trademarks
Identify corporate ownership and innovation trends
Analyze patent litigation history to assess legal risk
cards.summaryText: Mine IP databases to map ownership trends and litigation exposure.

cards.title: Criminal Records and Court Case Analysis
cards.description: Researching criminal histories and active legal proceedings.
bulletpoints: Access federal and state court databases for case records
Use PACER and state judiciary portals for criminal cases
Analyze legal filings, verdicts, and sentencing history
cards.summaryText: Pull court dockets to assemble criminal histories and ongoing case details.

cards.title: Regulatory and Compliance Filings
cards.description: Extracting intelligence from financial, environmental, and corporate filings.
bulletpoints: Analyze SEC, EPA, and financial regulatory filings
Track corporate disclosures and risk reports
Monitor companies flagged for compliance violations
cards.summaryText: Review regulatory filings to surface compliance gaps and disclosed risks.

cards.title: Identity Verification and Background Checks
cards.description: Validating identities using public records and databases.
bulletpoints: Use Social Security Death Index and voter records for verification
Analyze public utility and property records to confirm residency
Cross-check alias usage, known associates, and past addresses
cards.summaryText: Corroborate identities by triangulating public records, utilities, and alias trails.

cards.title: Investigating Leaked Databases
cards.description: Analyzing publicly available leaked records for intelligence gathering.
bulletpoints: Search Have I Been Pwned and breach directories for compromised data
Analyze leaked email addresses, passwords, and database dumps
Investigate leaked financial, legal, and government databases
cards.summaryText: Probe breach dumps to uncover exposed credentials and sensitive records.

cards.title: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) Filings for Financial Intelligence
cards.description: Using UCC records to uncover financial relationships and secured assets.
bulletpoints: Identify liens and financial obligations tied to businesses and individuals
Analyze loan and collateral details for financial vulnerability
Track mergers, acquisitions, and business debt structuring
cards.summaryText: Analyze UCC filings to trace secured assets, liens, and leveraged relationships.

cards.title: Tax Liens and Property Debt Investigations
cards.description: Analyzing tax liens, foreclosures, and unpaid debts.
bulletpoints: Use IRS, state, and county records for outstanding liens
Investigate foreclosure databases for financial distress signals
Track bankruptcy records and creditor claims for individuals and corporations
cards.summaryText: Monitor lien and foreclosure records to flag looming financial distress.

cards.title: Tracking Offshore Companies and Hidden Wealth
cards.description: Uncovering offshore corporate structures and financial secrecy.
bulletpoints: Use OpenCorporates and Panama Papers leaks for shell company research
Analyze tax haven jurisdictions and financial secrecy laws
Investigate beneficial ownership and proxy directors
cards.summaryText: Investigate offshore leaks to expose shell structures and beneficial owners.

cards.title: Public Contracts and Procurement Analysis
cards.description: Investigating government contracts and vendor relationships.
bulletpoints: Use USASpending.gov and procurement databases for contract intelligence
Analyze defense, infrastructure, and tech procurement records
Track vendor relationships and political donations tied to contracts
cards.summaryText: Inspect procurement data to map government spending and vendor influence networks.
